means: <口>曾经盛极一时的人，过时的人

sentence.Network_en: There has been a busy start to polling in today's local elections.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天地方选举的投票一开始就人头攒动。

sentence.Network_en: The Politburo has been meeting in Peking to discuss the situation.
sentence.Network_cn: 政治局已在北京召开会议讨论形势。

sentence.Network_en: There has been a very mixed reaction to the decision.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于这个决定的反应非常不一致。

list.abs: This SATA port is disabled because the system has been configured for ATA mode ., 由于系统已组态为 ATA 模式 , 因此该 SATA 连接埠被停用.
the drainage system has been aged., 排水系统已经老化了.
The company has been downsizing ., 公司一直在缩小规模.
He has been womanizing for years ., 几年来他一直在玩弄女人.

entry.tran: 过气的人物;风光不再的人
entry.def: If you describe someone as a has-been, you are indicating in an unkind way that they were important or respected in the past, but they are not now.

example.ex: ...the so-called experts and various has-beens who foist opinions on us.
example.tran: 将观点强加给我们的所谓专家和各式过气人物

means.word_mean: 1. someone who is no longer popular
